title: Academic Programs
description: Explore our undergraduate and graduate programs in Aeronautics and Engineering.

programs.name: Aeronautical Engineering
programs.summary: Design and analyze aircraft and aerospace systems.
programs.description: A rigorous program focused on aerodynamics, flight mechanics, structures, and systems engineering.

programs.name: Mechatronics Engineering
programs.summary: Integrate mechanical, electrical, and computer engineering.
programs.description: Interdisciplinary focus on robotics, control systems, and embedded software for smart machines.

programs.name: Aviation Management
programs.summary: Prepare for leadership roles in aviation operations.
programs.description: Covers airport operations, airline management, safety, and aviation policy with industry partnerships.

programs.name: Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS)
programs.summary: Study design, operations, and regulations for drones and UAS platforms.
programs.description: Hands-on UAS training, autonomy, mission planning, and sensing for commercial and research applications.

programs.name: Avionics & Electrical Systems
programs.summary: Focus on aircraft electronics, sensors, and electrical power systems.
programs.description: Covers aircraft wiring, avionics architectures, power systems, and embedded avionics software.

programs.name: Human Factors & Aviation Safety
programs.summary: Study human performance, ergonomics, and safety management in aviation.
programs.description: Emphasizes human-centered design, safety systems, fatigue management, and human-in-the-loop testing.

programs.name: Aerospace Materials & Structures
programs.summary: Explore materials, manufacturing, and structural design for aerospace.
programs.description: Topics include composite materials, fatigue, structural testing, and lightweight manufacturing techniques.

programs.name: Propulsion & Power
programs.summary: Engine and propulsion system design and analysis.
programs.description: Covers jet engines, turbomachinery, propulsion integration, and alternative power systems for aircraft.

programs.name: Flight Operations & Training
programs.summary: Pilot training, operations planning, and crew resource management.
programs.description: Combines flight instruction, operational planning, and simulation-based crew training for career pilots.
